content.text: What is the name of the device used to provide oxygen to a conscious diver?

images.alt: A demand valve oxygen delivery device

content.html: What is the name of the device used to provide oxygen to a conscious diver?

content.text: What is the expected response time for provision of basic First-Aid including Oxygen administration?
content.html: What is the expected response time for provision of basic First-Aid including Oxygen administration?

content.text: The duties and responsibilities of the designated oxygen provider are: (multiple correct answers)
content.html: The duties and responsibilities of the designated oxygen provider are: (multiple correct answers)

options.text: Make sure the oxygen cylinder is re-filled and all used items replaced after any incident
To be competent in the correct use of oxygen at the surface and within the chamber
To complete daily checks to ensure all components are present and function tested
To ensure oxygen is on site, clearly labeled and accessible

content.text: Which oxygen delivery device can be used on an Injured Person who is conscious, alert and orientated? (multiple correct answers)
content.html: Which oxygen delivery device can be used on an Injured Person who is conscious, alert and orientated? (multiple correct answers)

content.text: On what flow rate must this device be used on?
content.html: On what flow rate must this device be used on?

content.text: All oxygen pressure regulators are to have: (multiple correct answers)
content.html: All oxygen pressure regulators are to have: (multiple correct answers)

options.text: A contents gauge to indicate how much oxygen is available
A functioning flow meter to set the oxygen flow control in Liter(s) per minute (LPM)
To be well oiled and greased
Have a o-ring and correct lubrication

content.text: In what position to you place an Injured Person who is unconscious?
content.html: In what position to you place an Injured Person who is unconscious?

options.text: Place them flat on their back (supine)
Place them in a semi-seated position
Allow them to maintain a position of comfort
Place them on their side (recovery position)

content.text: The brain can only survive short periods of time without oxygen?
content.html: The brain can only survive short periods of time without oxygen?
